sentences.en: A peculiar austerity marked his judgments of modern life.
sentences.cn: 他对现代生活的批评带着一种特殊的苛刻.

sentences.en: a peculiar staccato voice
sentences.cn: 特有的不连贯而且刺耳的嗓音

sentences.en: All this has made me feel quite peculiar.
sentences.cn: 这一切令我觉得有点儿不舒服。

sentences.en: Did you ever hear anyone sound so peculiar?
sentences.cn: 你可曾听过谁的声音如此奇特？

sentences.en: Flying at 1,000 ft. he heard a peculiar noise from the rotors.
sentences.cn: 在1,000英尺的高度飞行时，他听到旋翼发出一种奇怪的噪音。

sentences.en: He looked at me with a very peculiar expression.
sentences.cn: 他用一种很奇怪的表情看着我.

sentences.en: He walks in a peculiar fashion.
sentences.cn: 他走路的样子很奇特.

sentences.en: He's always been a little peculiar.
sentences.cn: 他为人总是有点儿古怪.

sentences.en: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
sentences.cn: 最近他有点怪异。

sentences.en: It seems very peculiar that no one noticed Kay had gone.
sentences.cn: 没有人注意到凯已经走了，这好像很奇怪。

sentences.en: Local colour lends [ adds ] peculiar interest to the novel.
sentences.cn: 地方色彩给这部小说增加了 兴味.

sentences.en: My books have disappeared — it's most peculiar!
sentences.cn: 我的书不见了——这可太奇怪了!

sentences.en: Now and again , he caught a whiff of a peculiar smell.
sentences.cn: 他不时闻到一股怪味.

sentences.en: Punks, soldiers, hippies, and Sumo wrestlers all have distinct hair styles, peculiar to their group.
sentences.cn: 朋克摇滚歌手、士兵、嬉皮士和相扑手都留着他们那个群体特有的独特发型。

sentences.en: Rachel thought it tasted peculiar.
sentences.cn: 雷切尔觉得它味道古怪。

sentences.en: She’s a very peculiar child.
sentences.cn: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

sentences.en: Something peculiar is going on.
sentences.cn: 出了怪事。

sentences.en: The problem of racism is not peculiar to this country.
sentences.cn: 种族歧视问题并非只有这个国家才有。

sentences.en: The wilderness campsite had its own peculiar enchantment.
sentences.cn: 野营地有其自身独特的魅力。

sentences.en: There was a peculiar smell in the kitchen.
sentences.cn: 厨房里有一股怪味。

sentences.en: There was something peculiar in the way he smiled.
sentences.cn: 他笑起来有点怪。

sentences.en: There's a peculiar person snooping around.
sentences.cn: 有个古怪的人在附近窥探.

words.tran_cn: 特别；尤其；古怪地；奇怪地

phrases.tran_cn: n. 旧时美国南部的黑奴制度

trans.tran_cn: 奇怪的，古怪的，异常的，特有的，特殊的
trans.tran_en: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way
